intro: Cephalomappa beccariana var. beccariana, commonly known as the beccariana cephalomappa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. This species is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
